Demand for Multifunction Copiers: Why One Device Does It All

June 17, 2025 Marga Enterprises

In today’s fast-paced work environment, businesses are looking for efficiency, simplicity, and value. As a result, the demand for multifunction copiers—devices that combine printing, scanning, copying, and more—is soaring. These machines streamline operations, reduce equipment clutter, and empower teams both in the office and remotely.

In this comprehensive guide, we explore why these devices are in high demand, assess the benefits, and help businesses make the right choice.

What Are Multifunction Copiers?

Multifunction copiers (often called MFPs) combine the capabilities of a printer, scanner, copying machine, and sometimes a fax machine into a single unit. Advanced models may include:

  • High-resolution scanning

  • Duplex and color printing

  • Wireless and mobile printing

  • Cloud connectivity

  • Secure user authentication

These “all-in-one” devices are designed to handle a wide range of document workflows efficiently.

Why Businesses Are Choosing Multifunction Copiers

1. Space and Cost Efficiency

  • Single device replaces multiple machines, saving office space

  • Lower upfront and maintenance costs compared to separate units

  • Shared photocopier/scanner/printer support across teams

This consolidation trend is a direct response to rising operational costs and spatial constraints, especially in smaller offices or co-working setups.

2. Integrated, Efficient Workflows

Multifunction copiers improve productivity by:

  • Consolidating workflows—scan, copy or print without switching machines

  • Connecting to digital tools through cloud and network

  • Enabling seamless app integrations like scan-to-email or scan-to-cloud folders

Users no longer have to navigate between devices—everything is accessible in one place.

3. Support for Remote and Hybrid Work

Demand surged as teams moved to hybrid and home-office environments:

  • Easy mobile printing from laptops or smartphones

  • Remote scan jobs sent directly to cloud storage

  • Secure document handling, even when outside the office

For more insight on how remote work is impacting copier needs, also check out our post on the Impact of Remote Work on Copier Rentals.

4. Enhanced Security and Compliance

Modern MFPs include:

  • Secure print release (PIN or ID validation)

  • Encrypted data storage

  • Audit trails for compliance in regulated sectors

These features reduce the risk of data leakage and ensure sensitive documents remain protected.

Challenges in Meeting This Demand

Despite the benefits, businesses face several obstacles:

  • Cost concerns, as MFPs can be pricier than basic printers

  • User training needs, especially when implementing new features

  • Device compatibility issues with legacy systems

Managing these challenges requires thoughtful planning and support. Our article on Challenges Facing the Copier Rental Market covers these issues in more detail.

How to Educate and Engage Users

To ensure successful adoption of MFPs, providers and businesses should:

  • Provide walkthroughs and guides for common functions

  • Showcase benefits like cloud integration and mobile access

  • Gather user feedback to refine device setup and usage

  • Offer ongoing training as new features or workflows are introduced

Effective support helps users fully leverage multifunction devices. Read more in our guide on Consumer Education and Engagement.

Strategic Partnerships Purpose-Built for MFPs

Some copier providers are partnering with IT, security, and cloud vendors to provide a more comprehensive solution:

  • Bundled device and cloud-printing plans

  • Subscription models with maintenance included

  • Centralized admin portals and analytics dashboards

These strategic alliances and partnerships give customers more cohesive and capable offerings.

How to Choose the Right Multifunction Copier

Here are important considerations:

CriteriaWhat to Look For
Print volumeMatch the device to your team’s daily needs
Workflow needsCloud integration, secure printing, mobile apps
Support and trainingOnboarding and ongoing technical assistance
Security complianceEncryption, user authentication, audit logging
ScalabilityEasy to upgrade as your needs grow
Total cost of ownershipFactor in support, servicing, and supplies

Choosing an MFP that aligns with your workflow and growth plans ensures long-term success.

Final Thoughts

The demand for multifunction copiers is more than a passing tech trend—it’s a response to evolving business needs. These versatile machines reduce complexity, offer secure and efficient digital workflows, and support both office-based and remote teams.

If you’re considering an upgrade or rental, look for MFPs with strong security, mobile and cloud features, responsive support, and smart partnerships that deliver comprehensive service.
